Production is the provision of goods and services in order to satisfy human needs and wants.
The three branches of production are industry, commerce, and direct services.

Industry deals with the extraction of natural resources (raw materials) and transforming them into semi-finished or finished goods. It is divided into extractive (primary), manufacturing (secondary), and construction (secondary).

Commerce deals with the distribution of both raw materials and finished goods from the source/place of extraction or manufacturing to the place of demand/scarcity. It includes trade and aids to trade (warehousing, communication, transport, insurance, banking, and advertising) which help distribute goods and services to consumers.
Direct services are non-material goods that play an indirect role in production by enhancing it. Examples include services rendered by teachers, doctors, architects, the police, and lawyers.
There are two main types of production methods: Direct Production and Indirect Production.
Direct Production is the production of goods for one's own use on a subsistence level, satisfying only one's own needs and wants without needing exchange with others.
Indirect Production is the production for the benefit of others, which involves trading what has been produced. It depends upon trade and encourages people to specialize in one field.
Factors of production are essential resources or inputs that must be in place before any production can take place. They are Land, Labour, Capital, and Enterprise/Entrepreneurship.
Land implies the place or venue where production is done. It includes all natural resources like copper, coal, fish, water, animals, and trees. The reward for land is Rent or Rates.
Labour is the human effort applied in production. It may be Manual/physical (unskilled) or professional/mental (skilled). The reward for labour is a salary or a wage.
Capital refers to resources that man uses to produce goods and services. Examples are money, buildings, machinery, and raw materials. The reward for capital is interest.
Enterprise/Entrepreneurship is the ability to organize other factors of production and involves making decisions like business expansion and investing. The reward for entrepreneurs is profit or loss.

Specialisation is the process where individuals, businesses, or countries focus on producing specific goods or services efficiently. This leads to higher productivity, better quality, and cost reduction. A disadvantage is that it may create dependency on other producers for goods and services.

Original goods are durable, expensive, and attractive. Quality goods meet customer expectations in terms of performance, durability, and aesthetics. Substandard goods fail to meet customer expectations in terms of quality and reliability. Counterfeit goods are fake or unauthorised replicas of real products.
